Top Hotel Collections Resorts Best Hotels 3 Star Homestays View All Hotels In Manali List of Waterfalls in Manali Manali is a haven for wanderers and nature lovers. The umpteen trekking trails, bounteous nature and gorgeous waterfalls in Manali attract tourists from all over the country. Enveloped amidst dense w (Read More)oods, tall deodar trees and mighty cliffs, the silver cascading water falling from a height is a delight to the eyes. These amazing waterfalls are also a popular place for day picnics. Other than being an ideal spot for trekking (for both amateurs and professionals), the waterfalls are also flocked by nature enthusiasts and photography buffs. We have compiled an elaborate list of waterfalls in Manali, have a look now! Here is the list of 6 Beautiful Waterfalls in Manali That You Ought to Visit 1. Jogini Waterfall, Manali 4.6 /5 Jogini Waterfall is located in the beautiful Valley of Manali, about 3 kilometres away from the bustling town and around 2 kilometres away from the famous Vashisht Temple. What makes it a popular tourist spot is the trek from Vashisht Temple, through pine trees and orchards, to the mesmerising Jogini Waterfalls cascading from a height of 160 feet. Timings : 24 hours Time Required : 5-6 hours Top Attraction : Vashisht Temple Tours starting from ₹4,572 Read More 2. Jana Waterfall, Manali 4.5 /5 Jana Waterfall is a 30 feet high watefall located near Manali in a quaint village called Jana. One has to trek to the waterfall through dense deodar and pine trees amidst snow-capped mountains. The climb is easier compared to many others in the region and can be completed by beginner level hikers too. There's a wooden bridge laid perpendicular to the direction of Jana Falls which trekkers use to walk across. There is also seating arrangement near the waterfall. Timings : 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM Time Required : 1-2 hours Entry Fee : No entry fee Best Time to Visit : September to June Read More 3. Rahala Falls, Manali 4.3 /5 Rahala Waterfalls, located at a distance of 29 kilometres from Manali Bus Stand, is a well-known picnic spot for locals and tourists on their way to Rohtang Pass. The water here is usually cold as it originates from a melting glacier situated in the Himalayas. The surrounding is thickly vegetated with deodar and Silver Birch trees. The snow-capped Himalayan peaks can be easily seen from various locations around the waterfall. Timings : 6:00 AM - 5:00 PM Time Required : 1-2 hours Entry Fee : No entry fee Read More 4. Rozy Waterfalls, Manali 4.3 /5 Rozy Falls is situated en-route Rohtang from Manali and is a popular tourist attraction. Enveloped in tall deodar trees, dense woods and bounteous nature, the silvery cascading water is a visual delight to the eyes and a famous picnic spot. Time Required : 1 hrHow to Reach: It is 28 kilometres from Manali and takes an hour to reach. You need to take the Manali-Leh highway. This waterfall attraction in Manali is accessible through Himachal Pradesh public transportation buses and taxis.Open: 24 Hours Read More Manali Travel Packages Compare quotes from upto 3 travel agents for free 3 Nights / 4 Days 3 Night 4 Days Manali Tour By Volvo Manali(3N) ₹ 7,500 10% off ₹6,750/person Get Offers> 4 Nights / 5 Days 4 Night/ 5 Days Manali Kasol Package Manali(3N) → Kasol(1N) ₹ 12,000 16% off ₹9,999/person Get Offers> 4 Nights / 5 Days Manali Shimla Package 4 Nights 5 Days Shimla(2N) → Manali(2N) ₹ 18,000 16% off ₹15,000/person Get Offers> 2 Nights / 3 Days Mesmerizing Manali: Honeymoon Special Manali(2N) ₹ 6,000 0% off ₹6,000/person Get Offers> 7 Nights / 8 Days Shimla Manali Dharamshala Dalhousie Tour Package 7 Nights 8 Days Dalhousie(2N) → Dharamshala(1N) → Manali(2N) → Shimla(2N) ₹ 28,000 28% off ₹20,000/person Get Offers> 4 Nights / 5 Days Magical Manali Tour Package for 4 Nights 5 Days Manali(4N) ₹ 9,500 21% off ₹7,500/person Get Offers> View All Packages For Manali View All Packages For Manali 5. Knoi Waterfall Knoi Waterfall is a lovely 20-foot drop waterfall from the Himalayan rocky mountains near Manali. It is best to visit during the rainy season to swim in the waterfall's flow and have a shower bath beneath it. During the non-rainy season, however, this waterfall is dry. The cascade and its base resemble a cave structure formed by large stones of granite. A day trip is the ideal way to visit this site and truly appreciate it.How to Reach: You can take a private cab or Himachal transport buses from manali to reach here. It's just 10 kms away. 6. Sagoo Waterfall, Manali 4.2 /5 Often referred to as the frozen waterfall, Sagoo Waterfall is one of the various cascades in the Himachal valley. It is located near Rohtang Pass, midway down the Manali-Leh route. Stunning views of the snow-capped Himalayas, lush meadows, and numerous trees grace the site. The area is home to numerous bird species, which makes it one of the best places for birdwatching. Location : Leh Manali Highway, Near Marhi, Himachal Pradesh Famous For : Sightseeing, Birdwatching, and Trekking Read More Which of these waterfalls in Manali have you visited?
